column1:
michaelvader,"2010-04-05T17:07:29.717Z","Kinda small but sill its pretty cool!","

I got this set for Easter and built it right away! So I'm going to to tell you about this set in parts!
Minifigs: I love these minifigs! My fave's are Dastan and Asoka. So lets review EACH of them!

Dastan: I love the new hair piece they put on him. And to some people who think its Indys head well they slightly changed it. The BEST part is the thing on his back that holds his swords! The only thing is that if you have the swords in and you try to seat him, well... it does not work.

Princess Tamina: 1st off I didn't know that her hair was long in the back. It never shows in any pictures so I thought it was short. But the hair is still awesome. And ah yes, the white cape. Its nothing that

column2: I love that they did not put any red marks on this face to mess it up. He has the same body as the Alamut Merchant but most of it is coverd up so who cares!?

column1: Alamut Merchant: Um... He has a knife, a cool head, and a head thing.
Ok I'm done with the Minifigs so lets move on to
Fruit cart: To me its a waste of bricks so I took it apart.
Camel: Its a new lego animal! So I guess It is used for work?
Table: Its a TABLE! so move on to the next thing.

The Main temple thing: Gold! Lots and lots of gold pieces! Ok so lets see... oh yes. The trap door is very nice but it is not even with the floor. The path way is nice and steady. And its always nice to have stairs.

Legoragon,"2010-04-14T01:43:49.437Z","The fight for the... CAMEL!","this set is quite interesting. despite the lack of a real well made building it does have a nice appearance and awesome new elements. The camel.... amazing, the back sheath thingy....incredible, the merchant's hat... cool and the camel.... EPIC ( i know i said camel twice.) Another cool feature of this set is the new elements that are everywhere
column2:
for example the 2x2 flat plates with bump in the middle,the dome elements, the whip (untwisted), the white cape and the camel. A few things about this set that i don't like are the excessive use of trapdoors and also the gold guy... his helmet may look cool in the picture but it is much to tall for the person. So that's about it (there's a camel too in case you didn't notice)
",TRUE,4,5,3,5,4

column1:
David1971,"2010-05-09T15:48:36.357Z","Unusually beautiful!","

This is a lovely set. These Prince of Persia sets are a really nice theme. I don't know if the movie will be any good - that doesn't really matter. At least it means we have these great, very well designed sets. They are not like some
column2:
hastily-produced movie tie-in. Each one seems to have been very thoughtfully designed, and it is so nice to see a different kind of Middle Eastern architecture in Lego. This one is very pretty, with the lovely gold dome and other very nice building features (as well as reasonably clever trap doors). The minifigs are great, including a nice female one (Princess Tamina), and the man in golden armour is also highly unusual! And as well as all that, you get a camel (a camel!!), a generous supply of apples and cherries, plus torches, plants, fish, etc. This is all really nice. Since this building was so delightful, alas I now have a strong desire for set #7573, Battle of Alamut, the really super big building, as well. These are good sets and better value than the Star Wars sets - Jerry Bruckheimer must be somewhat less demanding than George Lucas!

",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

column1:
ProofR,"2010-05-02T19:26:36.403Z","Great set! Many accesories and interesting stuff","

This set is pretty good. In contains 258 pieces. And every piece is worth. You get 4 minifigures.
column2: Dastan, Princess Tamina, a market seller and Asoka.&nbsp
column3: All of them pretty good and 2 are exclusive to this set. You get many more stuff of course.

column1: You get the main building. A camel with boxes. A car. A table... and a lot of interesting pieces. For example the golden dome pieces, the food, the camel, the flames. And for me dark tan and nougat color look very good, and I love them. If you want to make an arabian diorama, this set is an essential definitively.
You also get a lot of accesories. A turkey leg, 2 fishes, 6 cherries, apples, 2 katanas, a katana holder for Dastan, 1 spear, 1 dagger of time.
<li>Camel, flames, food, diamonds, white cape for Tamina

Ok. I love this set! Oh, and if you are mexican like me, and you wanna know its cost, it is 550 pesos. Of course, it depends of the store you buy it on.

",TRUE,4,5,4,4,4

benjadude11,"2010-04-25T13:31:39.217Z","booby traps that work","I got this set instead of ostrich race because a) it is bigger and b) I thought it had more opportunities for MOCing and better playability. I will do my review in parts:

The Minifigs:
column2:
Four minifigs is good for a $30 set, five if you count the camel, and they are all very cool. Dastan has his awesome cross sheath for his swords and his usual unique hair. (or maybe it's not so unique now that I have three.) The market seller guy has a nice printed torso and great white head robe thingy. he also has two knives. Princess Tamina is nice also with the white cape. I give lego credit for not using the two by two slant piece as a dress like they normally do with girls. It limits mobility and makes them too tall. Last but not least is Asoka, the gold guy. His torso underneath his breastplate is the same as the market guy's (yup, lego cheaped out again) but it really isn't an issue, because you can't see it. His face is bearded and looks mean without being evil.

The Tower: The tower/walkway really aren't that big, but they are cool anyway. The tower has two great booby trapped parts to it, too. the balcony falls and so does the floor on the second story. Neither mechanism is particularly complicated, but that's perfectly fine because they work so smoothly. I also love the dome.
column4: The fish and fruit stand is really superbly done. I did not previously have either apples or cherries, so I'm excited by those, and their generous quantities. (3 apples, 5 cherries.) I also like the dagger of time, but my favorite is the camel's baskets. They are so good looking with the one stud 4x4 plate.&nbsp
column6: At the end of the day this is a great set, if a little bit expensive. but then again, all sets are too expensive. Buy this set. Think of it this way: Ostrich might be a delicacy, but it really is tough and bland. Apples and cherries are always sweet and delicious.&nbsp

column1:
SpiderMana,"2010-05-22T11:07:11.607Z","Just blew my B-day/Grad money! :p","

Fight For the Dagger-

-is a great set. I also own Battle of Alamut and the Ostrich Race set (which I haven't opened), and this one seems to fit in well. I bought this mostly for the minifigs: another Dastan can't really hurt, Tamina has a great new hairpiece and another decent peach girl face, Asoka has a nice new (to me, at least) face, the new golden armor, and last: the Alamut Merchant. This guy unfortunately has the same face as one of the figs from Alamut, but his headgear makes up for that. It really goes well with Tamina's cape.

Thus, I'd rate the minifigs: 5/5 (You are getting two of the same shirt from Asoka and the Merchant: the one from the ostrich race, but it's a great one for making random Persian Minifigs.)

Now the accessories. The weapons are nice, but when you already own two daggers of time, plenty of silver spears, and six torches, they become a shadow. The really nice parts are the food and the whip. Having Three apples (no biggie, I already own four-ish), SIX red cherries (I had just gotten two from Pick-a-Brick.. lucky me.), and two fish (YEY! My first ones!). The whip is also nice, and you could use it when Indy's grabbing something with his whip! (I own about eight Indy sets... and thus eight Indy whips.)

Accessories: 4.5/5

The Build/Pieces: This build is relatively simple, but I like it. The two traps right next to each other is nice, but almost a bit too much. The pieces, though: the pieces are great. Lots of Dark Tan and the new color, and the Camel, though great, is Dark Tan, which makes it awesome. :)

Pieces: 5/5 (For the Camel!!)

Playability: Fine... the trap door usually works and the balcony will always fall. The only problem is that they need a bush on the end of the pin to keep the trap door level. But really nothing amazing

Playability: 4.5/5

And the Price: Decent for the 'fig amount and the Camel and the pieces, but Lego rarely has great prices.

Price: 4/5

Overall: 4.5/5
",TRUE,5,5,4,5,4

shieldsy,"2010-06-11T16:58:46.483Z","The mighty fight for the dagger","Welcome to my review of the fight for the dagger set.
minifigures:
Dastan:Dastan comes with a katana holder which contains two katana's.There is both torso and trouser printing on this set and there is no back printing.
Princess Tamina:Tamina comes with a white cape.She has only torso printing.
Asoka:Asoka comes with a golden helmet,armor,the dagger of time that Dastan has to fight for
column2:
and a silver spear.The disapponting thing about him is that he has the same torso as the market salesman.
Market salesman:This random figure has a printed torso and is complete with a headress ,chicken leg and knife.
the tower:
The tower is the main part of the set.It has a walkway and stairs (which is one piece).There are two traps in this set.Those traps are a falling balcony and a loose floorboard that falls.On the top of the
column3:
tower thereis golden dome pieces.
the market place:
This is where the market salesman makes his money.The objects included for the market are three apples,two fish
column5:
two cherries.It also comes with a waggon and table.
the animals:
There is one animal in this set.The first lego camel!.The camel comes with boxes that contain an emerald,ruby and diamond.In the other box there is three cherries (I added the spare one in).
overall:
I would give this set an 8/10 because it is small but has lots of playability.
-shieldsy",TRUE,4,5,3,5,5

column1:
Firox_5000,"2010-08-27T16:26:22.76Z","Dagger fight","

I got this from Toys r us on a sale for £23.99.

The set includes Dastan with a nice new sword holder mould on the back, Princess tamina who can have either a happy or serious face, a guard with gol armour and market seller with chicken and knife in his hands.

the main strucutre of the set consists of wha looks like a small market scene which has tradional steps on the left with a medium lenghed thin path way which leads up to a small open building. The lower level is empty while the top has some nice new quarter dome pieces which are a shiny gold colour. The middle floor has a red soft roof on the left with a new flame piece on the front. The middle floor also has two traps. The pole at the back releases the balcony if pushed out while the one on the right drops the floor if pulled out.

The set also includes a never done before lego camel. The camel is a really nice addition and is certainly cool and a high demand just like the ostriches. The camel is carrying two containers. One with cherries and the other with gems inside. There is also a small market stall,wagon with fruit and a thing you put the camel on which is practically useless really.

The build takes probably 30/35 minutes and is quite straight forward mostly. the set is quite durable as for it's size it has a lot of features as mentioned above. For £29.99 [ it's rrp] The set is a bit pricey but compared to recent additions is quite reasonable. i think for good value the set could be £25 but luckilly I saved 20% off the rrp when I purchased it.

I thoroughly recomend this set for the figures,playability and camel. If you find this on sale , Get it!

",TRUE,4,5,4,5,3

column1:
AETerry,"2011-01-23T21:10:02.727Z","Fight for the Dagger Review","

Looking at this set and looking at the movie scene it's based from, I don't think it's that accurate. Still, it's a good little set to have, featuring a lot of little details and LEGO design that invokes the Middle East/Persian feel.

There are four minifigures and a Camel in this set. The other set to get a camel in, is The Battle of Alamut. The Merchant's stall is cool, certainly for the abundance of LEGO apples and cherries that he's selling. Call me a sucker for some of these accessories, but the way I plot and plan out my MOCs, I'm looking at what accessories can help detail it out.

At $29.99, that's a bit steep. Some may wait to get it on sale if it can still be found or gotten a hold of.

Added 9-5-11

One thing to watch out for with this set, is the quality of the individual bricks, on the second time through building this set together, I have noticed many cracks among several pieces. If this is an example of the plastic and quality from China and the Chinese produced plastic, I can see why many people are complaining.

",TRUE,4,4,3,4,4

GBP_Chris,"2011-07-17T16:57:10.19Z","Incredible Set","This set is incredibly built, from the building itself to the market stand to the cart, and even to the camel. There is a good selection of minifigures, a good array of gold elements, and fantastic arch pieces. The accessories (the&nbsp
column2: dagger, jewels, fruit, whip, etc.) are a nice addition to anyone who loves those type of pieces. As for the price, I bought this and the Desert Attack set for $20, so in that scenario it was a good deal. If I had to, I could comfortably pay the $30 that it originally went for. Overall, great set. Buy it if you can!",FALSE,5,5,5,5,5

column1:
Odeinoichus,"2012-01-23T15:13:43.207Z","Retrieve the Dagger of Time!","

Set #7571 The Fight for the Dagger: This is one of the must have sets from LEGO Prince of Persia, it includes a lot of great new pieces along with familiar pieces in unfamiliar colors.

The model represents a building, I'm not sure from which city in the movie, but it has a lot of great building techniques to make it look like a piece of an old Persian marketplace. I especially like the way they make the roof of the small building and the fact that this set includes a single piece staircase.

It also includes the new LEGO Camel, a great and cheap way to get it as opposed to picking up the Battle of Alamut. You also get a few Green Apples and Red Cherries. Plus a Turkey leg and one of the new Fish pieces.

The Mini-Figures in this set are some of the best, there is the ever present hero of Persia, Prince Dastan, we've seen him before. His brother however, Asoka is only available in this set, wearing a pearl toned armor and helmet pieces, the helmet is all new in this Theme and great for MOCing purposes. Underneath his armor he features a double-sided torso piece, it isn't a unique torso piece however as it is shared by the Alamut Merchant.

Princess Tamina is the fourth and final Mini-Figure, wearing all white, with a white cloth cape and a great torso print, she also has a double-sided head and a unique hair piece that LEGO has recently brought back into other Theme sets. (I've seen it in a Bricks and More Set from 2012.)

There are a lot of great weapons in this set, a spear for Asoka, Dastan's twin swords, the Merchant's carving knives (you get two) and of course, the titular Dagger of Time. This unique weapon isn't going to be seen again I'd wager, and it is a great new weapon for LEGO Mini-Figures to wield, with an impressive sculpt.

Overall I'd say that all of the LEGO Prince of Persia sets are really great and worth owning for any LEGO fans, this one includes a lot of nice new pieces and a great build complete with play gimmicks, a trap door floor and a collapsing balcony, plus this set is the cheaper of the two to feature the new LEGO Camel. I highly reccomend it, not just for MOCing potential, but because the LEGO Prince of Persia Theme is a great little Theme to collect and complete.

",TRUE,4,4,4,4,4

column1:
Galaxy12_Import,"2019-11-12T19:39:46.693Z","Small Section of a Big world","

The Fight for the Dagger provides a staging ground for some action-packed desert brawling. The assortment of tan and dark tan parts are welcome and among these we receive a genuine LEGO camel, an uncommon sight to be sure. Trapdoors and fabric awnings help bring the small street to life, and the fruit stands lend to the marketplace atmosphere that serves much background time in the movie.
With four minifigs, this street front finds a nearly perfect balance between the model and the characters. Dastan alone displays leg printing but this doesn'
column3: torso prints on the other three characters. The gold armor is the icing on the cake here, allowing each of the four figs to bring something unique to the building table. For a more in-depth look at these figures ahead of their time check out my video review&nbsp
column4: in the selling and review tabs below the set images.

column1: Discontinued in 2010 you will have to find this set on the secondary market. Buying used is probably the way to go but double check that nothing major is missing.
